Reviews.Title: Works exactly as described!
Reviews.Author: Norman Breed
Reviews.Content: I installed this in a small business and connected their cameras to it after their DVR died.  This works good.  Installed a 2 TB SATA hard drive as that was the largest it says it supports.Pros:- Hardware setup was easy for it to be working.  Installing the hard drive took a second to figure out the brackets as they could go numerous ways but would only work correctly one way.- Connecting the monitor and the cameras was no issue.Cons:- The internal software is not great.  It did come with the latest firmware which was good.  However the firmware appears written very simply.  It is pretty easy to figure out.- The documentation is very limited also.- The external software to view the cameras is not very easy to set up and configure.  It says you can view directly from a web page, I tried that on numerous PC's.  Never got it to display video.  I installed the software and got that working on half the PC's in the business.  the other half would show connected but wouldn't actually display the video.- The tech support says 24/7 on the box but that is not accurate.  I tried to call numerous times to diagnose why some PC's would view the cameras right and never actually got through to anyone.  Also the website says they only work 9:30 (maybe 9) pacific to 5pm.- Playback to find an incident is limited also and requires downloading and then viewing, don't see how to just hit rewind and view it.Ignoring the cons, for the price, the system does record video and has actually helped already with an incident.They have just designed it to be harder to use than it need be.

Reviews.Title: Great value, works great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I finally decided to write a review for the Q-see qs206 I bought a few months back from Amazon.  So far I am very impressed and happy that I bought this thing.  I bought my house about 5 months ago and when I met the elderly next door neighbor she told me that two houses on the block were burglarized.  I found out later that the burglaries happened 5 years ago, but the neighbor is old and she left that part out.  Anyways, I decided that I would like some security and did some research.  I read an article about this guy who monitored his house's security cameras from his Iphone and saw someone rummaging around in his house, called the police and the guy was arrested (I love stories like that!).  So one of my priorities was to be able to instantly look at all my security cameras from my Android phone.  I also wanted to be able to monitor my cameras from any computer, my laptop for example.  I also wanted LOTS of cameras, or at least the ability to hook up lots of cameras.  Also, since I don't have a security system installed just yet I wanted some kind on notification of detected motion in the house.  Finally I wanted value (hey, I just bought a house and those aren't cheap where I live: SF Peninsula).  After browsing Amazon for about 20 minuets I ordered the QS206.  I got it all configured in about an hour or more without too much difficulties.  The software is pretty easy to use and not too complicated (pretty basic really).  For some reason the mouse pointer did not show up at first, but after configuring some settings it shows up now, I don't know what that is all about.  I went to the Q-see website and searched the support page and did not find too much documentation.  Later, I googled "QS206" and found a product specific page for the QS206 (tinyurl.com/7gbrluz for easy reference).  Why they don't link their specific product support page directly from their main support page I don't understand, but whatever, I found it.  I used one of the PDF's from the site to easily walk me through the port forwarding process to connect my QS206 to the internet.  Later on I had to assign a specific LAN IP address on my router so if the power went out the router would assign the same IP to the QS206 so I wouldn't have to change the forwarded ports every time the power went out.  I figured out how to do that from my routers documentation.  My wife has an iphone and I have an Android.  Instead of using the android "MEYE" software that came with the QS206 I downloaded "MEYE" from the market on my phone.  It did not work, so I went and downloaded the vMEye software and it works great (after a phone restart).  My wife's Iphone worked great after restarting her phone.  The QS206 comes configured to automatically record upon detecting motion, and it is pretty easy to set up the areas you want to trigger recording.  As for the internet monitoring be advised that you have to change the security settings in Internet explorer to allow it to download and install the ActiveX software when you go to look at your cameras from any computer.  For me this means that I can't monitor my cameras from my work computer because there is no way that my company will allow the security setting to be changed or lowered on my work computer.  So for me at work I can only monitor my cameras from my phone, which was a little disappointing but understandable.  There are other ways to broadcast video feeds that I can see on my work computer, mainly splicing the camera signals and sending them to a server that broadcasts streaming video (but that is outside the scope of this review).  The monitoring software does work great from my laptop at home via the LAN or anywhere via the internet.  From the laptop I can configure most of my system and watch recorded video.  For some reason there is no rewind button when you are watching a video, but you can easily download the specific video to a flashdrive and watch it from your computers video player.  I bought a 1TB hard drive to install and put in in with no problem.  Overall I think this is a 5 star product and a great value.NOTES:-Use this site (tinyurl.com/7gbrluz) to get the latest documentation and walk-throughs for the QS206.-The documentation says that you need IE8 to view the cameras from your computer, but that info must be outdated because IE9 works flawlessly.-You can use firefox to your cameras but you have to install an add-on (IE TABS I think it's called).  I had to try 2 different add-ons to find the one that worked.-For droidx the MEYE software did not work, but the vMEye software works great.-If I think of anything else I will update this review.

Reviews.Title: Wont' work in Multiviewer
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: Q-See told us all QS models would work with Multiviewer so we bought a QS458 for the house and a QS 206 for the shop. Now after weeks of trying to get them to work together and many calls to Q-See, we find out they are not compatible. Amazon will only give us half of the $200 the QS206 cost so we are really screwed now. I have to buy a new QS 4816 which is $400 and it's too late to get full credit on the QS206 if I return it. I'm pretty pissed aobut this.

Reviews.Title: Have questions, any help would be appreciated.
Reviews.Author: Nolan
Reviews.Content: My 8 camera system got hit by lightening and I am considering this system to replace it. What picture setup is available with this unit, I had an option for a quad view or a 3 x 3 (9pic)view or single sequential, etc.What kind of views are available with this system? I would like to have a 4 x 3 (4 camera shots across and 3 rows showing 12 individual cameras simultaneously) or 4 rows of 4 cameras showing all 16 cameras. Can I select from a menu the cameras that will show and the position on the screen of each?Any help would be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: Great product but missing HDD mount to keep HDD stable
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: Great product love it. Installed so many of Q-see dvrs and this was also easy only issue is that there is no HDD mount or fixing stuff inside the DVR. So you have to be careful.Also, software might not work on windows Vista. Trying to get Q-see multiclient from other product and will see if it works. but over all great product.

Reviews.Title: Simple DVR that does the job
Reviews.Author: MVOLtd
Reviews.Content: The Q-See QS-206 Dvr is very easy to manage. The price is good and it has all the basic functions. I like the ability to use the built in DDNS client which is now very useful since dyndns starts charging for there service. It has 16 channels, which is great. The only thing I would need is more audio in and maybe 4 video loop out for security monitor. But overall it's a great product.

Reviews.Title: Arcane Operating System, User Unfriendly
Reviews.Author: FranzJ
Reviews.Content: I am simply disgusted with this product. I have experience setting up DVRs. I have a 4-channel one on my house right now that works as described and took me around 30 mins to get it working on the Internet. This product, however, lacks proper documentation, has a software system that reminds me of the early days of windows computing, when it was only for specialists. I would not recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Patrick Meullion
Reviews.Content: It came on time and works like a charm Thanks. I do recommend this to others and will be using them for further products

Reviews.Title: 16 Channel DVR
Reviews.Author: Joey
Reviews.Content: I bought this as the cheaper alternative to a more expensive DVR. It only records in CIF resolution, which is very low quality and may not be what many are looking for. I would recommend getting a better quality DVR if security is a much more important thing for you. But for a cheap DVR with good capabilities and not so high end specs, it does the job.
